alert.note: Alert for Bexar (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 13 at 5:52AM CDT until May 13 at 8:00AM CDT by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM CDT THIS MORNING... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of south central Texas, including the following county, Bexar. * WHEN...Until 800 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Some low-water crossings may be impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 550 AM CDT, Gauge reports indicated heavy rain occurred overnight. This is causing urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1/2 inch are possible over the area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... San Antonio, Schertz, Cibolo, Universal City, Live Oak, Selma, San Antonio Int Airport, Stinson Municipal Airport, Randolph AFB, Leon Valley, Helotes, Fair Oaks Ranch, Kirby, Alamo Heights, Windcrest, Terrell Hills, Bulverde, Shavano Park, Hollywood Park and Cross Mountain. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
